list_definition.definition: (especially in the names of shops/stores) a place where goods are sold

list_ex_of_english: Co-operation is needed between farmers and livestock marts on the one hand and renderers and abattoirs on the other.
A vast number of cattle come through the marts every day of the week, and those cattle are unknown to anybody.
Scrutiny of live auction marts is also inevitable.
For a short time there was much bewildering consternation in all the marts and exchanges in the world.
The train of events is affecting farmers, processors at the marts, factory workers and butchers.
Circulars could also be available at post offices and marts, directed to farmers with empty cottages, persuading them to enter into hirings.
Quite apart from destroying the value of property and the general amenities, these marts are a great nuisance to shoppers and residents.
There are the merchants and auction marts that deal with these commodities.
